snippet.title: Best GPS systems
snippet.description: We've selected our Top 5 picks for in-car GPS navigation systems. We will frequently update this lis

snippet.title: Windows 8
snippet.description: Navigate the ins-and-outs of Windows 8 with how-tos, troubleshooting, news, and reviews.

snippet.title: Ricoh WG-4 GPS (Blue)
snippet.description: This update to one of the toughest point-and-shoots around is now ready to be mounted to your bike, helmet, or car.

snippet.title: Garmin Nuvi 3597LMTHD
snippet.description: The Nuvi 3597LMTHD continues to refine Garmin's brand of navigation with premium design and one of the best interfaces in the business.

snippet.title: Navigon USA & CAN navigation
snippet.description: The Navigon app for Android brings the quality maps and routes that we expect from a Garmin-branded navigation product, but the interface spoils the experience.

snippet.title: Top-rated reviews of the week
snippet.description: Do you get your gaming notebooks from MSI and Asus, and your pub trivia experience from your phone? Maybe not, but we've found some reasons why you should. This week CNET's editors also found a four-star camera, router, and superthin, superfast portable drive. Check 'em out.

snippet.title: GPS Buying Guide
snippet.description: Standalone GPS devices are slowly being displaced by smartphones and apps, but here are a few things that you'll need to know when shopping for a portable navigation device.

snippet.title: TrackPort GPS Vehicle Tracker
snippet.description: The TrackPort GPS Vehicle Tracker is easy to install and use, and you can monitor the position and status of almost any car via its Web portal.

snippet.title: Pioneer AppRadio 3 SPH-DA210
snippet.description: The Pioneer AppRadio 3 is significantly improved over the previous generation and one of the best choices for drivers wanting safe access to smartphone apps while on the road.

snippet.title: Top-rated reviews of the week (pictures)
snippet.description: Another week, another product-palooza. This week, CNET editors reviewed photo- and video-sharing apps, and a camera and a lens that rocked. Not only that, but we also covered a couple of impressive iOS games worth checking out. Oh, and the Samsung Galaxy S5.
